business.headline: Akriti Chopra, Zomato co-founder and Chief People's Officer, resignsIn an email to Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal, Akriti Chopra announced her decision to resign with immediate effect.
Explained: Why SJVN shares gained over 6% todayThe stock rose 6.03% to Rs 133.60 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), with a market capitalisation of Rs 52,520 crore.
Sensex, Nifty end lower after hitting record highs as financial stocks fallThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 264.27 points lower at 85,571.85, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 37.10 points lower at 26,178.95.

Swiggy files for Rs 10,000 crore IPO: Here's all you need to knowSwiggy's IPO will consist of two main parts: a fresh issue of equity shares worth Rs 3,750 crore, and an offer for sale (OFS) of 18.52 crore shares by existing stakeholders.

India once had a Rs 10,000 note. Know why it was discontinuedThe history of India's Rs 10,000 note dates back to the pre-independence era. In 1938, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) issued its first Rs 10,000 note, the largest denomination ever printed in the country.
What are multi-asset funds and are they good for your investment portfolio?Multi-asset funds are schemes that invest in a combination of three or more assets, such as equities, bonds, and gold.
China boosts exports: Will it hurt India, other global markets?With a slowing domestic economy, China is looking to global markets to absorb its excess production.

Real estate multibagger stock soars 260% in 1 year since IPO. Have you invested?Since its debut on the stock exchanges on September 27, 2023, the stock has outperformed not only its peers but also the broader real estate market.
Swipe, spend, struggle: How credit card defaults are spiking in IndiaOnce a symbol of freedom, credit cards now trap young Indians in growing debt. Could defaults be the new norm?

KRN Heat Exchanger IPO: Check latest GMP, subscription status, other detailsKRN Heat Exchanger opened for subscription on September 25 looking to raise Rs 341.95 crore from its public issue, and has already seen bids of over 80 times.

Accenture guidance boost lifts Infosys, Wipro; IT stocks rally up to 4%Accenture not only exceeded market expectations for its Q4 results but also raised its revenue guidance for FY25 to a range of 3-6%.

Isha, Akash Ambani among top young entrepreneurs in Hurun's under-35 listThe Hurun list celebrates 150 entrepreneurs aged 35 or younger from across India, marking their achievements in fields ranging from retail to tech startups.
Sensex, Nifty hit record high for 6th straight sessionThe S&P BSE Sensex added 67.47 points to 85,903.59, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 14.70 points to 26,230.75.

Swiggy files for IPO, aims to raise about Rs 3,750 croreSwiggy, backed by investment group Prosus and Japan's SoftBank, competes with Zomato in India's online restaurant and cafe food deliveries sector.

Will Middle East conflict dampen Dalal Street's rally? Here's what experts say Despite the uncertainty arising from the Middle East conflict, Indian stocks have surged, with benchmarks like the Sensex and Nifty showing strong gains.

Vedanta shares cross Rs 500 mark after gaining 5%. More gains ahead?Vedanta's performance in 2024 has been impressive, with the stock climbing 95% so far this year and gaining 124.35% over the last 12 months. Over a five-year period, the stock has risen by 202%.
Sensex, Nifty close at all-time high led by rally in auto and metal stocksThe S&P BSE Sensex added 666.25 points to end at 85,836.12, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 211.90 points to close at 26,216.05.
Tata Steel shares gain for 5th straight session. What should investors do?In the past year, Tata Steel has rallied 28%, with an 18% gain so far in 2024.

Trent shares surge to record high on Citi's 'buy' call. Check detailsCiti set a target price of Rs 9,250 for the stock, signaling a 21% upside from the previous closing price, and added it to its Pan-Asia high-conviction focus list.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Israel flattens Hezbollah HQ in heart of Beirut in quest of Nasrallah Live UpdatesThe Israeli military carried out multiple airstrikes on Hezbollah's central headquarters in Beirut, targeting leader Hassan Nasrallah, amid escalating tensions in the Middle East.

Chandrababu Naidu vs Jagan Reddy over faith 'declaration' at Tirupati templeChandrababu Naidu slammed Jagan Mohan Reddy for claiming TDP-led government obstructed his visit to Tirumala temple, saying "He is spreading lies".

Harry Potter star and Oscar winning actor Dame Maggie Smith dies at 89Oscar winning actor Dame Maggie Smith, who played the beloved character of Professor McGonagall in the Harry Potter series, died on September 27 at the age of 89.
Akriti Chopra, Zomato co-founder and Chief People's Officer, resignsIn an email to Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal, Akriti Chopra announced her decision to resign with immediate effect.
What doctors say about Rapamycin, the magic pill that can 'extend your life'Rapamycin has gained significant attention from 'longevity experts' as the key to a longer, healthier life.

Lokayukta registers case against Siddaramaiah in Mysore land scamIn a major legal challenge for Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, the Mysuru Lokayukta on Friday registered a case against him in connection with the alleged MUDA land scam.

'Human sacrifice' in UP, Class 2 boy strangled to bring 'glory to school'The alleged motive behind the murder was to ensure the prosperity of the school, which had been under financial strain. The accused believed that offering a human sacrifice would lead to the school's success.

Just a child: Deputy Chief Minister's son's reel shoot with cop escort sparks rowRajasthan Deputy Chief Minister and BJP leader Prem Chand Bairwa issued a clarification after a video featuring his son driving a car, escorted by police vehicles, went viral on social media.

Devara Part 1 review: Jr NTR, Saif Ali Khan shoulder predictable action dramaReleased-Fri Sep 27, 2024Devara Part 1 movie review: Director Koratala Siva's Devara Part 1, starring Jr NTR and Saif Ali Khan, is an action drama with elaborate characterisations. The film features strong performances from Jr NTR and Saif Ali Khan, but the story remains predictable.

2 killed as Israel strikes Hezbollah command in Lebanon's BeirutIsrael Hezbollah War Live Updates: The Israel Defence Forces (IDF) on Friday carried out precision strikes on Hezbollah's central headquarters in Beirut's southern suburbs. According to several media reports, Hezbollah leader Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah was the target of the strike and the Israeli military was checking if he was hit. Iran-backed Hezbollah's al-Manar television reported that four buildings were destroyed and there were many casualties in the multiple strikes, which marked a major escalation of Israel's conflict with the heavily armed, Hezbollah. Meanwhile, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu also cut short a visit to the United States and was returning home.

JD Vance's 2020 messages resurface: Donald Trump 'thoroughly failed to deliver'The messages were sent by JD Vance during Trump's last year in the White House. Vance messaged his acquaintance on the social media platform, which was then known as 'Twitter', criticising Trump's failure to fulfil his economic agenda as well as his methods of governance.

Two dead as wall near Ujjain's Mahakal temple collapses due to heavy rainA wall near the Mahakal Temple in Ujjain collapsed due to heavy rainfall on Friday, killing two people. Some others are feared to be trapped under the debris.

Flipkart apologises for video calling husbands 'aalsi, bewakoof' after backlashThe video, promoting Flipkart's 'Big Billion Days Sale,' has since been removed from their social media platforms after the backlash.
Video: Nainital homestay owner shares experience with 'unruly' guests from Delhi-NCRIn a video on Instagram, Nature View Villa shared a video documenting the mess that the guests had left behind.
Gunpowder, seaweed and the accidental discovery of iodineFrench chemist Bernard Courtois accidentally discovered iodine while working in his father's saltpetre business in 1811.

Canada MP slams 'Khalistan extremists' over fresh Kanishka bombing probe pleaIn an address to the Canadian Parliament, Chandra Arya said two public inquiries had already found Khalistan extremists responsible for the bombing of Air India 'Kanishka' flight.

Who flooded Waqf Bill JPC's mailbox?The huge number of suggestions that the Joint Parliamentary Committee (JPC) on the Waqf (Amendment) Bill received has sparked a controversy. Panel member and BJP MP Nishikant Dubey sought a probe into the role of China or Pakistan's ISI over the 1.25 crore submissions. The All India Muslim Personal Law Board said Muslims had sent 5 crore feedback to the JPC against the bill.

Jagan Reddy cancels Tirupati visit, says Chandrababu Naidu lying about ladduYSR Congress Party (YSRCP) Chief and former Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister YS Jagan Mohan Reddy has cancelled his planned visit to Tirumala amid the controversy over allegations that animal fat was used in the preparation of the temple's prasadam laddus.

For British pension, Bahadur Shah Zafar plotted against sepoys in 1857Indian sepoys who had raised the flag of revolt in 1857 reached Red Fort and urged Bahadur Shah Zafar to be the symbolic head of their fight. The last Mughal emperor, living off a pension from the British, wrote letters to the British conspiring against the Indian sepoys. A look at the pension worries of Bahadur Shah Zafar amid 21st century India's pension conundrum.

Tamil Nadu: ATM robbers who used gas cutters to break into machines nabbedA gang of robbers was nabbed in Tamil Nadu after they robbed three SBI ATMs in neighbouring Kerala's Thrissur using gas cutters early on Friday.
Video: Moment Dart spacecraft crashed into asteroid intentionallyThe target of DART's impact was Dimorphos, a small moonlet orbiting the larger asteroid Didymos.

Silent spectators: Supreme Court blasts air quality panel over Delhi pollutionPulling up the Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM), the Supreme Court said not a single committee was formed to tackle the stubble burning issue.

India's bid for permanent UN Security Council seat gets major push UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer on Thursday backed India for a permanent member of the United Nations Security Council (UNSC) during his address at the United Nations General Assembly's 79th session in New York.

Emergency: Bhindranwale dialogue, firing scene among 13 cuts by censor boardThe censor board has recommended final cuts and changes to Kangana Ranaut's Emergency. This includes removal of a few violent scenes and reference to Bhindranwale as a 'saint'.

Aditya Roy Kapur to Arjun Kapoor, celebs at Ranbir Kapoor's birthday bashRanbir Kapoor's mother, Neetu Kapoor, arrived at his home for late-night birthday celebrations. Akash Ambani, Aditya Roy Kapur and Arjun Kapoor were also a part of the intimate birthday party.

Video: Akash Ambani arrives at Ranbir Kapoor's birthday partyAkash Ambani, a close friend of Bollywood actor Ranbir Kapoor, was clicked arriving at the latter's house in Mumbai for his midnight birthday bash.

Pics: Chiranjeevi to Venkatesh Daggubati, stars shine at IIFA UtsavamSouth superstars such as Chiranjeevi, Venkatesh Daggubati, and others made stylish appearances at the IIFA Utsavam green carpet in Abu Dhabi. The first day of the awards night will celebrate the four South Indian film industries.

Vivek Agnihotri fires lead actor because of his manager's arroganceVivek Agnihotri shared on X that he recently fired a leading Bollywood actor due to his manager's arrogance. The filmmaker criticised the influence of talent agencies on actor management.

sports.headline: Women's T20 World Cup 2024 warm-ups: All you need to knowWomen's T20 World Cup 2024: The warm-ups will have 10 matches to be played across three venues from September 28 to October 1. India's matches are against West Indies and South Africa.

IND vs BAN, 2nd Test Kanpur Weather Report: Heavy rain likely to washout Day 2The Day 2 of the second Test between India and Bangladesh is likely to be washed out due to heavy rain at Green Park, Kanpur. Bangladesh are 107/3 in 35 overs after Day 1.

Watch: Livingstone hits Mitchell Starc for 4 sixes in huge 28-run over ENG vs AUS: Liam Livingstone smashed his way to a 25-ball fifty as Mitchell Starc leaked 28 runs in the final over of England's innings at the Lord's Cricket Ground.

Watch: Rishabh Pant's advice to R Ashwin results in a wicket on very next ballIndia wicketkeeper batter Rishabh Pant's advice worked instantly for Ravichandran Ashwin on Day 1 of the second Test against Bangladesh at Green Park, Kanpur.

Luke Ronchi asks New Zealand batters to step up after tough day in GalleSL vs NZ, 2nd Test: Luke Ronchi said that after a tough day in the office with the ball, New Zealand will look to make a comeback in the batting department.

India favourites, but don't underestimate Australia: Jess JonassenWomen's T20 World Cup: Jess Jonassen backed India to perform well in the mega event, but also said that Australia can't be underestimated given their past records.

ENG vs AUS: Josh Inglis faces fans' ire for claiming grounded catch during 4th ODIAustralia wicketkeeper Josh Inglis was slammed by fans for claiming a grounded catch during the fourth ODI against England at Lord's.

Cameron Green in doubt for India Test series after back injuryCameron Green won't be a part of the remaining ODIs between Australia and England after he sustained a back injury in the third game of the series.

Shaheen Afridi laughs off his workload concerns raised by coach Gary KirstenPakistan fast bowler Shaheen Afridi laughed off any concerns on his workload raised by his white-ball head coach Gary Kirsten. Afridi is currently playing in the Champions One Day Cup for Lions.

Sunil Gavaskar slams 'crybaby' English media on air with R Ashwin's exampleLegendary India cricketer Sunil Gavaskar slammed the English media on Day 1 of the second Test between India and Bangladesh as he recalled Ravichandran Ashwin's magnificent hundred in Chennai.

Bangladesh fan Tiger Robi clears air around his hospitalisation in Kanpur TestBangladesh cricket super fan, Tiger Robi, confirmed his hospitalization was due to dehydration, dismissing rumors of foul play. His health scare briefly overshadowed an intense Day 1 of the second Test between India and Bangladesh.

New Zealand reeling after Kamindu Mendis goes big on Day 2SL vs NZ: Kamindu Mendis, Kusal Mendis and Dinesh Chandimal's hundreds have put Sri Lanka in a commanding position in the second Test in Galle.

Rishabh Pant's hilarious stump mic chatter in Kanpur Test: Helmet pe bhi lbw lengeIndia wicketkeeper batter Rishabh Pant made a hilarious comment on the stump mic on Day 1 of the second Test against Bangladesh at Green Park, Kanpur.

Sri Lanka's Kamindu scores 1000 Test runs as quickly as Don Bradman: StatsSri Lanka vs New Zealand, 2nd Test: Kamindu Mendis became the fastest Asian batter to complete 1000 runs in Test cricket. He equalled Don Bradman on the list of batters with fewest innings to achieve the landmark in the traditional format.

Virat Kohli's 15-year-old fan travels 58 km on cycle to watch his star in KanpurA young fan of the star India batter Virat Kohli travelled 58 km on cycle to watch his favourite player in action during the second Test against Bangladesh at Green Park in Kanpur.

Aleem Dar to retire from umpiring after ongoing domestic season Aleem Dar will retire from professional umpiring after the ongoing domestic season in Pakistan. He served as an umpire for nearly 25 years after making his debut in the 1998-99 Quaid-e-Azam Trophy.

Bayern Munich looking forward to facing champions Leverkusen: Vincent KompanyBayern Munich boss Vincent Kompany has claimed that his team is ready for the challenge of going up against the Bundesliga champions Bayer Leverkusen. Bayern have made a strong start to the season.

He equalled Don Bradman on the list of batters with fewest innings to achieve the landmark in the traditional format.

Bayern Munich looking forward to facing champions Leverkusen: Vincent KompanyBayern Munich boss Vincent Kompany has claimed that his team is ready for the challenge of going up against the Bundesliga champions Bayer Leverkusen. Bayern have made a strong start to the season.

Ashwin and Jadeja will dictate the outcomes of Tests during BGT: Glenn MaxwellAustralia all-rounder Glenn Maxwell has said that the Indian spin duo of Ravichandran and Ravindra Jadeja will determine the result of the Border Gavaskar Trophy 2024-25.

Watch: Kanpur police escort Bangladesh fan 'Tiger Robi' to hospital Tiger Robi,' the passionate Bangladesh cricket fan, was carried off the stands by security officials on Day 1 of the second Test between India and Bangladesh. According to police sources, Tiger Robi's health deteriorated on Friday morning, requiring immediate hospital admission due to dehydration.

With shades of Sehwag, Shafali learns to blend maturity with aggressionShafali Verma spoke to India Today in an exclusive interview where she talked about her double hundred against South Africa and the way she has improved her game since her debut for India back in 2019.

2nd Test: Akash Deep stars as rain halts India charge, Bangladesh resistanceAkash Deep was the star of the show on Day 1 of the Kanpur Test as India's charge was halted by rain and a fine fightback from Bangladesh, led by Mominul Haque on September 27, Friday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
